review_detailed_main: This movie is not the worst movie ever made, don't believe what some may say, because for one it has an actual plot, music is not too bad for it's time and Targos character is actually pretty entertaining. Yes, it's boring, stupid, has incredible bad acting and fails as a horror movie, but it has somewhat entertaining in it, what you couldn't say about f.e. Disaster movie - that movie will hurt you physically, this one will give you some cheap laughs and for the most part just bore you to sleep - it's not bad, when you compare, I've even found first ~ 20 minutes of Manos somewhat entertaining and well built, if they had scary villain and maybe some monster to back it up I would've actually enjoyed it. I would say - give it a try, or - give Targos a try, that guy really nails the role and for someone like me, who's into bad movies, that's enough to find some fun in this underrated flick.

review_title: Even after so many years, it's still one of the worst movies ever.
How many people have even seen this movie?
review_detailed_main: From reading the reviews for this movie (which is right now #12 on the bottom 150 films), I can tell that less than 1% of the people who reviewed this have even seen the complete un-MST'd "Manos the Hands of Fate". Well, I may stick out like a sore thumb, but I liked this movie. Not enough to watch it over and over and over again, but I think that the fact that its low budget helped it be a little creepy. It has a documentary-like quality that makes it look eerily like a snuff film. The bizarre music, the bad lighting, the average acting, Torgo's sickening costume, and the strange dubbing help make it one of the more intriguing low-budget films of the 60s. That's right, I liked this movie, it didn't bore me very much, and I would watch it again. You can watch the MST3K version of "Manos", but you'll lose a great deal of the movie and its atmosphere. Give it a try without MST3K (who also ruined "The Brain That Wouldn't Die", "Revenge of the Creature", "Squirm", and several other underrated classics), you just might be surprised. Given that I have actually SEEN the original "Manos", I think I deserve a bit more credibility than those who have relied on MST3K's judgment, not their own.

review_title: Ecch!! One of the WORST movies ever
Hard to compare a movie that cost $20,000 to make with one that cost $200 million.
review_detailed_main: The movie is far from being the worst movie ever made in consideration of the cost to make it and comparison to the 100 to 200 million dollar farces the studios are putting out today. Ignoring all its shortcomings it is interesting enough to watch to the end and ask yourself what the £@#$ was that. This is another movie where the background story on how the movie was made is more interesting than the movie itself.

review_title: Its either hilarious or numbingly painful
review_detailed_main:
There is only one way to watch this bad excuse for movie, MST 3K style! It's hilarious when you watch it that way.

ON THE OTHER HAND This movie has a emaciated plot, terrible sound/acting/lighting/story progression/camera. It should not be in existence! The opening of the film alone bores you to the point where you want to perform the "Eye splinter scene" from Lucio Fulci's Zombie on yourself, just because you had to watch this movie. The opening scene is more than 10 solid minutes of driving in a car and doing nothing! AHHHH! Do not watch this movie, under any circumstances. I would rather disembowel myself and cannibalize my intestines that have to watch it again. (Without the Mystery Science Theater 3000 of course)

review_title: Don't watch this without the bots, the master would not approve
review_detailed_main: I love weird bizarre movies, especially Japanese ones. I've sat clapping to Ifukube's wonderful score in Chikyu Boeigun, Daikaiju Baran, and Uchu dai Senso. I sat shocked and shivering to Mondo Cane, Denso Nigen, Kyuketsuki Gokemidoro, and especially Tetsuo. I've sat laughing in Frankenshutain tai Baragon, Uchu Kaiju Guilala, Gamera tai Uchu Kaiju Bairasu, and Gamera tai Daikuju Guiron. And I've sat just loving it in Matango, Daimajin, Kaidan, and every Saturday morning on Teletubbies. However, when it comes to watching this movie it's like this, it's like taking a needle. I would have truly spontaneously combusted if the bots and Joel weren't there, tearing the movie to shreds on MST3K. The plot contians a family who has to stay at a creepy manor owned by a guy named Torgo who has the fattest thighs I've ever seen and who talks in a bizarre voice when their car breaks down. This leads to the resurrection of a satan like character named the master and his hounds of hell. This just has horrific dialogue and sound quality, grainy blury color photography, and an annoying song that accompanies the beginning and end credits, how bad does this get! Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!

review_title: Don't even entertain the thought of seeing the non-MST3K version of this.
review_detailed_main:
After reading all the negative hoopla surrounding the "worst film ever", I decided to rent "Manos: Hands of Fate" to see if it was really as bad as everyone says it is.

And they were right. This film is absolutely atrocious. Bad films usually have a habit of having one aspect of film-making that's done horribly while all the other aspects are sub-par. Manos did everything horribly and made sure they drove the point across.

But if any one aspect was more horrendous than the others in Manos, it would definitely be the cinematography/editing (if you could even call it that after "Manos's" creators butchered it). Hack-job isn't the word to describe it. "Rape and torture"-job is the word for the filming and editing. There are moments in the film where the camera would be firmly planted at some obscure place (such as the back of someone's head or not even at the actors speaking) or switch abruptly to some badly-framed object. Editing was equally horrendous, as transitions would either be completely black screens or annoying white flashes, and actors/objects/animals in the last frame would change position or pop in at the next frame.

Scenes in "Manos" have an odd habit of having no relevance whatsoever. One re-occurring scene in particular (a viscous five-minute lip-locking session involving 2 twenty-somethings and a bottle of cough syrup...err I mean whiskey) served no purpose whatsoever except to add more characters to a story which already had too many characters with 4 mains. Add to this ten minutes of driving through non-descriptive fields with soft jazz (bad jazz at that) in background, another five minutes of women in translucent nightgowns wrestling, three minutes of one of the women groping and nuzzling the Husband, 2 minutes of Torgo (the huge-kneed, mysteriously twitching servant to the "Master") nuzzling a sleeping women, and some more scenes where the characters stand in absolute silence waiting for the next cue, and you've got a movie with at least 50 minutes of filler.

Writing is well... nonexistent. The writer seemed to take cliché lines, then copy and past them on every other line. Seriously, a good 60% of the film's dialogue is one corny phrase repeated after another.

And there is no plot. To say that the plot is cliché is incorrect; the plot cannot be cliché because the plot does not exist. In place of even a poorly scripted plot, there is a assortment of random events, each more logically absurd than the next. Plot-lines also have a tendency to pop-out of nowhere and leave just as quickly (which is surprising, given that a five year old could comprehend the basic premise of such a simple story). The characters that make up this jumble are less than cardboard cut-outs (To be cardboard cut-outs is a phrase that suggests that characters are cliché and fit into a nice niche completely lacking originality or complexity); No characters exist. People are merely there quoting atrocious writing (acting isn't even the proper word; more than once I caught the wife attempting with every fiber of her being not to look directly into the camera). The only exception to this is the misshapen, Parkinson's Disease-afflicted Torgo, which comfortably plops into the monstrous-servant roll (I mean, come on, they might have well given him a humpback and put him in a castle with a mad scientist).

The sound in "Manos" is terrible at best. The background music sounds like the creators took the tracks they play at supermarkets and mixed it with every other horrid B-Movie of the 1950s-60s. Sound effects and dialogue had to dubbed in later as the camera the creators filmed with could not record sound, and as a result almost every piece of noise or sound in the film is about a second and a half late.

So, in short, if you decide to take the plunge, at least do it with the MST3K crew by your side and laughing all the way (even then you might not make it to the end of "Manos", I didn't).

Technically, in everyway, this is the Worst Movie Ever. Are there or have there been worse? Probably. Have any of them made it to distribution in theaters? Probably not. And yet, there have been movies I've seen that I've disliked much more than this. Don't see "Manos" looking for... well anything. You won't find it. Just expect to laugh until your gut hurts or your mind melts from the sheer crappiness.

review_title: A thorough crock of crap
review_detailed_main: This movie, if you want to call it that, is a completely horrible waste of film, lights, and other equipment. I saw this with my friends on the MST3K version, and even then, it was difficult to sit through all the garbage. The film features the unforgettable character of Torgo, who watches over the house while the master was away. We were trying to figure out why his legs were twice the size they should have been, and only thru IMDb were we able to discover that he was supposed to be a half goat/half man. I don't know what the point of the story was, nor do I care. The person who made the movie was a fertilizer salesman, which is fitting, cause it's a pile of manure.

review_title: Hilariously bad
review_detailed_main:
Manos: The Hands of Fate is one those movies, which you watch and think "what the hell am I watching anyway?".

It is widely known, that Manos is among the worst movies ever produced and even that is a bit of an understatement. Bascically what we have here, is a home movie, in which nothing works like you'd expect it to work. The narrative is jarring and odd, the actors are amateurish at best and the dubbed voice work is just hilariously awful.

To top things of, Manos is lazed with a bizarre fusion jazz sound track, which knock the movie in an entirely different ball park among bad movies.

For people, who like bad movies Manos is a must watch event. Everything that can be done wrong in a movie has been made wrong in it. And even then some.

review_title: You know, this movie has a few flaws...
Truly Worst Movie EVER!!!!
review_detailed_main:
This is in case you've read all other reviews and are still thinking about watching the horror that is Manos the Hand of Fate, the first thing that should warn you is the title. Manos means hands!!!! it's Hands: the hands of Fate! Oh still don't believe me?

Bad sound, the scenery so droll, a main character making stupid decisions, a "menacing" painting more shots of the droll scenery, too much focus on the dog and painting, an annoying little kid. Manos himself for some reason looked like what the pringles logo mustache guy would look like if he came to life and was an evil porn star.

The only redeeming quality of this flick is Torgo, oh my god where do we even start? the character playing him was rumored to be blitzed out to Pluto on acid while shooting and man does it show. I warn you, if you've little patience for really really really bad movies, you may want to skip this, or at the least watch the MST3K version. I has to suffer through the undiluted pure evil which is Manos I think those of us who've watched it should get a T shirt reading: I watched Manos: the Hand of Fate and all I got was this T shirt.

review_title: High Cinema
Visual Torture
review_detailed_main: Many reviews have made this point, but this movie ranks as perhaps the worst movie ever made in the history of the universe. Many buffs rank Ed Wood's "Plan 9 From Outer Space" as the "worst of all time". Not even close. "Plan 9" is "Citizen Kane" compared to "Manos". It's "Casablanca" and "Wizard of Oz" rolled into one next to "Manos". But therein lies the wonder and the rub: Manos is so colossally awful that it transcends the notion of "movie" and takes on some sort of "Platonic Perfect Form" that defines "bad movie". Bless the actors and anyone else who collaborated on this abysmal piece of celluloid garbage, because it has provided us with MST3K's riff-rich snark that's as entertaining as the movie is horrible.

review_title: I take care of the place while the Master is away...
Get your hands on this one 👇🏿
review_detailed_main: I've seen this movie 3 times and laughed hard each time I did. The first was on MST3K and the other times with rifftrax. With that said I can't image what it must be like to watch this inept film without a commentary track pointing out how ridiculous it is from a technical and content standpoint. An 8 with MST3K, a 10 with rifftrax and a 0 on its own for an overall 6.

review_title: Just dull
Oh man, what a terrible movie....
review_detailed_main: I was first introduced to "Manos" as many of you were, thru MST3K and to this day my sister and I make jokes about the absolute wretchedness of this movie. The best part of the movie is the Torgo theme, brings tears to my eyes...that and Torgo's monstrously-sized knees...that's great....okay, so, Torgo. Torgo is incredible, give Torgo an Oscar...Yeah.

review_title: BAD
review_detailed_main:
This film is awful, i cant understand why people think it is good or defend it. I have only seen the mystery science version but I've seen enough. First off me and my friend thought it would be funny to watch this as it was in the IMDb bottom 10.

We watched it.

Its is not funny, it is just so bad, I've seen some funny bad films, cyber tracker because they are bad but this is impossible to watch as it just makes you depressed.

Throughout the film i was just so down and thinking why am i torturing myself by watching this.

The acting is utter crap, fair enough since none were even proper actors, there is no plot and none of the characters know why they are there or if a camera is pointing on them.

I know the facts behind this film but i fail to understand how the hell anyone on the film thought it had the possibility to be good. Did they even read the script. Then again there probably wasn't one.

Also i fail to understand where and what the hell $19000 was spent on. Acting classes, location, more than 3 voices, a becamera that shoots for more than half a minute? After watching it i can assure you its none of them.

Because this movie is so bad one of the actors, the only one with a bit of talent (torgo) killed himself afterwards because its so bad.

Please understand that someone committing suicide because they are in a film tells you something.

This is film is BAD BAD BAD so spare yourselfs as it does not need to be watched and is Certainly NOT FUNNY.

RIP Torgo

review_title: The absolute worst film in existence!
review_detailed_main: This is filth. Thank the Lord that none of the people involved in this, were ever involved in any other film. It's not just bad, it's horrific, it's a disgrace. You are probably reading this thinking i'm trying to be funny, but i'm serious. It's that bad. What is so bad about it? It's incredibly boring for one thing. When it's not it's just wasting time badly developing characters that are weird, stupid, naive, ignorant, useless, creepy, and boring. I'm not even sure I get it. This is my first review without spoilers because this completely fails in telling a story correctly. It also makes no sense; it never explains anything! And there are also shots that go on for way longer than they need to. It would have been more enjoyable if the movie was just a bunch of random pictures thrown together. But instead it's just boring nonsense. I felt like the film was so dumb that I got dumber watching this. Avoid this film at all costs!

review_title: Torgo!
review_detailed_main:
I just bought the MST3K tape of this episode, and I must say, it lives up to its reputation. While it may not be the worst movie ever, there probably isn't many seated much higher...

It's production is bad, but the dubbing is just horendous. Torgo sounds like he talks through a broken Speak-and-Spell! Also, the wildly meandering plot is deadly. It's one thing to have some subtlety to a movie, but hen a movie resorts to the actors just starring at each other for long periods of time, that's just too much....

review_title: Oh My god
review_detailed_main: I first saw this film very late (3 am) on some cable channel (sans the bots)I flicked onto it about 1/2 way - when the Wives start to fight. It was awful, it was a train wreck I couldn't turn away. I never caught the name of the film (they never said I'm not sure why) but I knew, down to my bones, that I was watching one of the worst things I had ever seen (and even then that was saying something). By the end of the movie, it was all I could do to drag myself to bed. Had I read The heart of darkness then I would have been saying "the horror, the horror" years passed and MST3K arrived. In all innocence I picked up the VHS of Manos since they said it was the worst film they ever did - popped it in the player and then realized Oh my god it's THAT FILM! The horror, the horror.

review_title: The Weird, Static, Horror Movie As Comedy
review_detailed_main:
I feel a little conflicted here. Manos is utter trash. It is ineptly made, badly acted, horribly scripted (scripted ?). If I could I'd give the movie two ratings, one--1--from what my logic and better sense tells me (it's crap), and another rating--say around 6 or 7--simply because I was entertained, I would.

There are things I find frustrating, yet humorous about Manos: How all the actors seem to wait a full minute or two before saying their lines, as if waiting for some cue; the odd repetition of dialog like something out of the nightmares of Samuel Beckett (but done unintentionally, it seems); the sheer lack of anything resembling narrative consistency or internal logic.

Make no mistake, this is a bad, bad, movie. But some movie masochists out there may find this entertaining. Hell, at least it's more creative than Bloodrayne.

review_title: Even the words atrocious and painful can't describe it
review_detailed_main:
Before you think of me that I am a masochist I'll explain what bought me to this movie. It's on the top of IMDB's Bottom 100, many name it as ''the worst movie of all time'', and it was even riffed on MST3K by Joel and the Bots. And yes, it's horrible as everyone said. And not in the sense ''so bad it's so funny''. NO!!! This movie is so poorly made that is a chore to watch it until the end.

The plot, if anyone cares, is about a family that gets lost in the desert and end in a home that at night becomes a underground devil-worshiping cult, led by the Master and the caretaker Torgo. And horrid things start; Torgo likes the woman of the family, the Master's wives start bickering, and Torgo gets killed just by burnign his hand (!!!)

''Manos The Hands of Fate'' is a movie that caused me pain watching it. The other time I felt ill watching a movie and it was fault of the movie was when I watched the FRED movies with Lucas Cruickshank. And everything in the movie is very hideous: the filming is sloppy and some scenes seemed lasting an eternity! The music... ughh. It was very creepy, monotonous, badly made and disturbing. And the acting is the worst I ever saw in a B-movie, I mean, worst than the other movies featured on MST3K. Hey, they look like Oscar-worthy movies compared to this! And the script was written in a room full of mandrills.

So, inept and horrid in every way you look at it. I recommend this movie to NOBODY. Neither humans, dogs, pigeons, baboons or parrots - NOBODY! Even them would find the movie very painful to watch.

review_title: Yes, I'm from "El Paso"
review_detailed_main:
Browsing through IMDB.com's worst movies and not sure exactly how fate put me in line with this gem. Interestingly enough, I was telling a good musician friend of mine about the movie, which came out the year I was born. I asked him if he knew anything about it. He sheepishly bowed his head and answered "I'm the one playing guitar in the soundtrack"

I couldn't stop laughing. It's a shame, if not obvious, that none of the cast did anything even remotely notable after this hit the market. I do want to say at least mostly all the musicians involved are now successful professionals playing all over the country and professors in universities. I promised not to name any names. To them my deep felt sympathies for being involved in this project, and also look on the bright side-at least it wasn't a porn loop you'd rather forget.

review_title: Astounding, for all the wrong reasons !
I underestimated this film, whens IMDB going to put 0 as a choice?
review_detailed_main: Amazing, this truly is terrible. Sort of one of those movies that you just have to see to believe. Absolutely awful, however I would rate Escape from LA, Batman and Robin and any of the two Shaq movies worse because they actually had a budget higher than 50 dollars.

review_title: Bad
review_detailed_main: Oh, bad. Terrible. It was . . . bad, just . . . no words to say . . . bad. So bad. So bad I can't even . . . so bad . . . can't form sentences . . . bad . . . It's just that . . . there's nothing . . . a void . . . a bad, bad void

review_title: Could be good if redone without the unrivaled low production
review_detailed_main:
Not the worst movie ever made but almost certainly a contender for worst production value. I can complain about how bad the film is but that seems fairly pointless since about 1000 people have already beaten me to it and while many of their gripes are unreasonable Manos doesn't deserve to be dubbed the worst film ever. Manos actually had a decent horror story to it and I think would have made a very good horror film but it suffered from an exceedingly low budget and abysmal production. The movie was an editing nightmare with such bad camera cuts it left me asking the question, what were they thinking? There were many other examples of what to avoid in film-making. There were long, tedious shots where virtually nothing occurred; superfluous panning of the open Texas range or simply watching characters stand silent for extended intervals as Torgo (very interesting character) hobbled around. But before I deal out unreserved criticism of this film, I make note of the fact that the technical aspect of its production was doomed to disarray due to the camera.

According to IMDb, Manos was "Filmed entirely with a hand-held camera that could only record thirty-two seconds of film at a time. The film was shot without sound." No wonder they had such a hard time editing it. It is for this reason that the film is an editing disaster. It would be nearly impossible to produce anything remotely well with such a technical handicap. From a more conceptual perspective, Manos is an interesting idea and the film had a spooky quality to it.

Like another user stated, awarding only one star to a film should be reserved for only the most inane of cinema, the kind of film that leaves the viewer angry at the sheer stupidity of the project. If you want examples, modern film-making has generously provided them. Films devoid of intelligence; movies made on large budgets, solely for monetary gain, generally just to capitalize off of some pop singer or pop culture icon (Paris Hilton for example) truly deserve the ridicule . Mano isn't a terrible concept, just an example of how technical barriers can cripple production.

review_title: Many people apparently don't understand what BAD is.
review_detailed_main:
I've watched MTHOF both with and without the comments of Joel and the MST3K crew. It was agonizing both times. When I look at the IMDb list of the worst movies, I simply cannot explain how ANY movies could be rated worse than MTHOF, especially movies like "Justin and Kelly" which, though an abominable movie starring two nonentities, actually had production values, a budget, and some sort of direction. It's obvious that some of the reviewers are picking on certain movies because the plot was ludicrous, or the direction was incompetent, or they hate the stars.

MTHOF, on the other hand, is the clear winner (loser?) by virtue of being awful in every possible category. This isn't a movie that failed to live up to its potential, or cast the wrong actors. No, this is a movie that shows what happens when absolutely no talent is available at any level.

It is a chore to force yourself to watch this movie, but I think that all those reviewers who were apparently horrified by "Justin and Kelly" need to take the time to see what a really bad movie is. But, do yourselves a favor and watch the MST3K version...at least you won't be as tempted to just give up partway through the movie.

review_title: Without a doubt, poison to the art of a motion picture
review_detailed_main:
Now, i'm not gonna go off and give this movie a cold review. I'm gonna go through all the motion picture arts, and see how "Manos" - The Hands of Fate adds up Acting -- Horrible. The best actor in this movie is probably Torgo, and thats not saying much. IT sounds like their yelling at you. Their unnatural, emotional depiction, looks, everything dreadful. To give you an example of how bad it is, take Tom Hanks, Johnny Depp, Russell Crowe, and Jack Nicholson, and think the COMPLETE opposite.

Art Direction -- Not much to say here. They used an existing house, and the stayed in basically two rooms the whole time, so there isn't enough room to talk about how bad it was.

Cinematography -- Ghastly. The angles in the ten minute car ride, showing the Masters picture 5 times in 30 seconds, while the picture is at the other end of the screen, it really makes me wonder how it can be that bad.

Directing -- Hollow. Maybe the reason was because the director really was tied to a tree the whole time Editing -- I can't decide whether it was done with cut and paste, or a hammer and chisel Music (Score) -- They used the wrong music at the wrong time Music (Song) -- "Row Row Row Your Boat." Very bad singing Sound Editing -- Most of the duologue was dubbed. They did a very bad job at it. Their lips would start moving and two seconds later you would hear them talk. Mixing that with the music, it was very poorly done.

Writing -- Not bad. When I heard of the plot, I was attracted to it, so I bought the movie. If all of the above would of been changed, this script would of made a good movie.

Overall picture quality, just bad. I guess i this is the movie to see if you have ever been sitting around at home, and your wondering what kind of film a fertilizer salesman from El Paso, Texas would make. I thought i could put up with it, but I starting clawing at my face when the movie was finished, only taking breaks to kick myself in the head.

I can say with true confidence that this is the worst movie ever made

review_title: If you don't watch the film with the Mystery Science Theater 3000 commentary, you'll end up making your own...
review_detailed_main:
'Manos' The Hands of Fate attempted something very few filmmakers have ever done before, and un-intentionally no less- this film goes below expectations, but not just any ordinary expectations. I knew right from the get go this would be a bad movie from the reputation it's garnered here on IMDb. However this takes the cake. It ends up being more embarrassing, more horrendous, and more offensive than anything cooked up from the Ed Wood school of low-budget, horror movie-making. On top of every performance (even John Reynolds' Torgo, who does pull off that insane servant look, despite no voice to match) stinking to high heaven, every single bit of craftsmanship takes everything that was set up in the cinema world right out the window.

The good news for people who wish to see it out of sheer curiosity is that it's now available from the Mystery Science Theater 3000 people (as it has been for ten years, one of it's most infamous specials). Their commentary is a plus, and just when you think it can't get any worse, it gets funny by way of them. It's hard to heckle a film. This is the prime exception. All the music, the camera shots (though, giving the benefit of the doubt, it's all shot with one camera getting 30 seconds at a time with no sound attached on location), the atmosphere, the flimsier-than-ripped-flip-flops storyline, it sets a standard that few movies can go to. Maybe that's its most impressive feat, that it takes itself so seriously as a legitimate, circa mid 60's B horror film, that it's fun just to watch and experience the depths it goes to. F+

review_title: It's impossible to credit Manos as the worst movie ever
review_detailed_main:
And here's why. YES, this movie was horribly acted. YES, the quality, editing, directing, writing, storying line, meaningless subplots were terrible.

But understand. This was a small group of no name people with a cheap camera who took a stab at a film with a very limited budget. If anything, (even though the film sucks) I applaud them.

ON THE OTHER HAND (no pun intended), take a movie like Battlefield Earth. There's others, but this one get's my vote for worst film ever. There's a fine difference between Manos and Battlefield Earth. Think of the concept behind this. FIRST, some nit-wit (we know who) wrote Battlefield Earth. THEN it had to be pitched to an agent. Agents takes the project on, THEN it needed to be pitched to a producer(s), THEN the producer needed to package it with big name actors and take it to the studio. THEN the studio has to green-light the damn thing. Then a bunch of Hollywood idiots invested MILLIONS with the anticipation that the film will be a success. Hal Warren and his little Manos film shouldn't even be ranked in a worst category, simply because it didn't take much of a budget and no one was destroyed (except maybe Warren's ego.) But I do agree, this movie was bad. It reminded me of a bunch of barn animals running around just bumping into each other.

review_title: Manos vs Torgo
Watching this movie made my brain bleed.
review_detailed_main:
There is not real way to describe how much this movie inflicts physical pain.

I first saw Manos on Mystery Science Theater 3000. After forcing myself to finish it, wondering if

this was for real, I realized something very important.

My brain had stopped working.

In all honesty, however, I was bothered for weeks afterward. Wondering how someone could create something so atrocious.

Either way, if you wish to see your brain fall from your skull whilst screaming in pain, this is the movie for you.

In all other cases, stay away if you value your LIFE!

review_title: Brain Dead
If There's A Worse Film, I Don't Wanna Know
review_detailed_main:
"'Manos': The Hands Of Fate" is bad, bad, bad. This is perhaps the ugliest film of the 1960s, and I'm counting Zapruder. The only way you can truly appreciate the badness of "Manos" is by seeing it, but that's like my recommending you go and get scarred for life.

I guess there are those who will object I really didn't see "Manos." I saw the Mystery Science Theater version with some bits cut out. But that's like saying I really didn't see "Sideways" because I went out at one point and got popcorn. It's hard to ignore that what's on the screen is bad, not because there's silhouettes of a guy and a couple of robots making fun of it but because of the sheer, relentless amateurishness of the film. Out-of-focus shots, long pointless silent scenes, women wrestling in togas, moths bumping into the lighting, and a stupid two-set horror play with a depressing ending. What's wrong with having someone talk over that? Would you deny morphine to a gunshot victim?

The only things I thought okay were the music, which was pretty fair dinner jazz, and the actress playing the young wife, who couldn't act but was beautiful to look at. Also, there's a bit where the Master's half-dozen wives awake from their ageless slumber and start to talking all at once. The camera cuts to the Master, and I'll give the director the benefit of the doubt and assume that look of put-upon henpeckitude on his face was intentional comedy. But there is nothing else worth discussing here.

A lot of times, bad films are fun to watch because they are so supremely silly and full-of-themselves they become perversely entertaining. "Manos" is just harsh and ugly. Joel Hodgson, the MST3K ringleader, says at one point: "Every frame looks like the last known photograph," and it's true. What's on screen are talentless people who are obviously miserable about what they are doing. Poor Torgo went and killed himself shortly after completing his role, and he may not have been the only one according to the info on this site. It's painfully to watch films like this and feel like you are a party to someone's endless torment.

So I maintain watching this with MST3K is not only preferable but necessary. As the little girl in this movie said later to interviewer Richard Brandt, "without their commentary, it would be painful to watch." Well, hold up there, sweetiepie. Let's just say "more painful."

review_title: Honestly, the worst movie ever made.
review_detailed_main:
I've seen the vast majority of the bottom 100 movies, as well as many other horrible flicks that were not on the list and I can honestly say that this is the worst. Horrendous production qualities, terrible repetitive dialog, at times completely incoherent, and 90% of the film serving no purpose to the primary plot... it was really a labor to sit through. There were times I actually cried from the pain of watching it and others I considered hanging myself because I could not possibly bare the thought of living in a world where this film existed. I would have trouble forcing even my most hated enemy to watch this movie. It is really, really, really bad.

Did I mention they dubbed over the entire thing? Well, apparently the camera they used had no audio, so some of the worst dubbing I have ever heard was employed with a bland repetitive soundtrack commensurate with Chinese water torture.

Basically, if someone says "Hey, let's watch Manos, the Hands of Fate" think of it as them saying "Hey, let's go castrate ourselves with a piece of steel wool and some elbow grease."

review_title: Amazingly bad!
Failure
review_detailed_main: The worst, worst, worst, worst, worst movie ever made. Absolutely appalling. It's excruciatingly painful to watch. I've seen quite a few MST episodes, and many more stinkers besides that. Manos leaves them all in the dust. What a piece of dung. Plan 9 would win an Oscar compared to this trash. It really has to be seen to be believed, but you must do so at your own risk, and be sure to use Joel and the 'bots as a shield...I pity the poor souls that have been subjected to Manos in its full glory. MST can't even make it funny, it's beyond laughable. It's disturbingly awful. I wish I knew some more disparaging terms, I feel I'm letting it off easy. In case you haven't noticed, I did not like Manos, the Hands of Fate.

review_title: The absolute worst
review_detailed_main: MANOS is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen, and I've seen them all -- AXE 'EM, PLAN 9, THE ITEM, etc. In fact, MANOS makes a so-called film like AXE 'EM look like a Shakespearean masterpiece. This goes beyond the worst drive-in fodder imaginable. For a lot of the running time, a gimpy-looking weasel with a droopy mustache stands around in a black cape with red hands painted on it. I was hoping he was trying to conjure up the Ghoulies, but no such luck. There isn't a monster or special effect to be had. I tried desperately to stay awake, but ended up dozing on and off throughout. When six slave babes in floor-length nightgowns finally got down to a hair-pulling cat fight in a sand box, I was hoping to see some T&A. Unfortunately, they were wearing giant bras and even larger, old-lady panties under their nightgowns. Steer clear of this one, even in the MST3K version. No amount of joking at the expense of this waste of celluloid helps.

review_title: THE HORROR!!!! THE HORROR!!!!
This film made me feel bored, physically sick and uneasy all at once
review_detailed_main: It's not scary at all, it's just weird and oh so dull, dull, dull, and goes on forever. The music is awful, the dubbing atrocious, the editing is the worst. Even watching it with the Rifftrax soundtrack, I gave up half way through because I felt sick watching it.

review_title: Not the worst movie ever made.
Nerve Munching Beast
review_detailed_main: A fine candidate if you - like me - sometimes reserve a special weekend where the only rule is that everything on the screen must be of superb badness only. It hardens your soul and makes your nerves stronger, sometimes you will even get a third eye, and if you look hard enough and are not stupefied by Manos: The Hands of Fate you will find even some dimly glowing moments of entertainment.

review_title: Only MST3K Makes It Watchable!
One of the worst movies ever made.
review_detailed_main:
In the pantheon of bad movies there have always been two that have been vying for the title of the "Worst Movie Ever Made". Those two are "Troll 2" and "Manos: The Hands of Fate". Well I'm here to tell you that whole "Troll 2" is bad in every sense of the word it is at least enjoyably bad. The same thing can't be said for this travesty. Sure you can get together with a group of friends and riff the hell out of it, but you can't really say that you enjoyed watching it.

This movie was the brainchild of a fertilizer salesman who made the film on a bet. He used a wind up camera that could only record 32 seconds of film at a time meaning that no scene lasts longer than that. There were also no microphones meaning that everything had to be recorded in post. Add to that nobody involved in the entire process knew anything about acting or film production. The result was a hot mess of a movie that honestly doesn't make any sense.

A family is driving in the desert on vacation and wind up at a compound where the father decides this is the hotel they've booked at. Why? It's the only thing around for miles so it must be the place. There, to greet them, is Torgo. He's a strange little man with huge knees who seems to have trouble walking. Torgo takes a liking to the mother. Stuff happens which is mostly forgettable and we find out the owner of the place is this weird dude with a harem of mind controlled women and he wants the mother and her young daughter to join his harem. There's some badly choreographed fights, one of the women in the harem dies from a light slap and like in the song "Hotel California", the family never leaves.

The only actor to get anything out of it was the young girl that played the daughter. She got a bicycle out of it. The rest were supposed to get a share of the profits. But since it was shown in only one theater and people hated it, nobody got anything. The actor playing Torgo died before the movie came out from a drug overdose. Some say that it was partially due to the leg prothetics he wore. he was supposed to be a satyr but either the devices they designed for him didn't work or he wore them wrong and they caused him extreme pain.

This really only should be watched out of sheer curiosity or masochism because there is no way to enjoy it. Even if you say you like bad movies, this is honestly too bad even for that.

review_title: Horrid piece of trash.
review_detailed_main: This wasn't as much a movie as a documentary on how to not to make a movie. Of course like all forms of art it is open to personal opinion. Well here's mine without any fancy movie critic terms. No breakdown of scene analysis, no comments on inspiration. This movie sucks so hard, bowling balls through garden hoses would be no problem. This is the kind of movie a "sedated" mind couldn't enjoy. MST3K couldn't save this movie so don't even bother with that version. The bots seemed as dumbfounded as I was, neither of us said much as we seemingly "survived" this movie.

review_title: So bad it achieves a kind of grandeur...
review_detailed_main: As I write this, there are already 143 previously existing comments for this film, and nearly every one of them mentions MST3K at some point. That's the irony of MST3K-- if not for Crow and Servo and Joel and Mike, no one would ever see or even hear of movies like Manos. It isn't lovable garbage, like the often-referenced Plan 9 from Outer Space, that you can watch with friends and laugh until your face hurts. It's painful garbage, the kind of movie where you chuckle a little towards the beginning but after a while it stops being funny. Is it the worst movie ever made, as is often claimed? I personally don't think so. It probably was the worst film that MST3K managed to obtain (and that episode, which actually makes something good out of this film, is some kind of comic masterpiece), but MST3K was by no means comprehensive. Remember, they weren't allowed to show anything with any real level of violence or sexual content, so there are lots of sneaky movies out there ruining lives because they don't have the reputation that MST3K grants. And I guess calling something "the worst movie ever made" is just a matter of personal sensibilities-- Manos is really boring, but there are movies that go far enough beyond the limits of bad taste to make me feel sad and angry and hopeless, like Necronomicon: Book of the Dead, Sword for Truth, Eaten Alive, Igor and the Lunatics, Knightriders, and even the illogically popular and overrated Dawn of the Dead. Manos is a complete waste of time, but there are movies out there that are bad enough, in terms of both craft and content, to make you want to kill them. And I personally don't think Manos goes that far. You can make up your own mind, though, if you're ever unfortunate enough to see it.

review_title: What was that?
review_detailed_main:
Never has a movie been so dumb, silly, bad, ugly, awful at the same time. Is "Manos, the Hands of Fate" really that bad as everyone says it is? Yes, it is and maybe even worse.

What makes "Manos, the Hands of Fate" a bad movie is that it was made with no talent or imagination, quite sad to watch really. I don't know what is the worst; The acting, the script, the sets, the editing. The most likely answer is that it's all just simply plain bad. Especially the editing is the worst I have ever seen. Some scene's seem to be endless while nothing is shown at it at all and most of the time they don't even have anything to do with the movie. The movie is full with this long endless shots that are really about nothing, very boring to say the least.

The story is just laughable bad, if you asked me what it is about I think I can not even explain it. It's just about nothing and lot's of it makes no sense at all. It feels like someone is poking you in the brains with a stick. The movie is full with silly moments that makes you think; What the **** is that?

The actors are by far some of the worst ever. They show absolutely no talent or what so ever.

Then we come to the only good thing about the movie: Torgo. Oh boy what a character! I doubt it was intentional but this guy is absolutely hilarious with his strange ticks and movements. He alone makes this movie still watchable. He is a real classic.

I also must admit that I liked the ending a lot. I even found it surprising and shocking but a good ending can't save a bad movie.

Congratulations Hal Warren, you created one of the very worst movies of all time, you make an Ed Wood movie seem like a masterpiece.

A must see for bad movie lovers.

1/10

http://bobafett1138.blogspot.com/

review_title: Potentially the worst movie I've ever seen
review_detailed_main: Even with the commentary from the Mystery Science Theater 3000 episode going for it, the true awfulness of this movie seeps out the edges. I believe I may very well die if I watch it alone, as it is, without Joel and the 'bots keeping me company. this stupid, insanely low-budget and zero-scare movie is one big excuse for a scene in which scantily-clad women fight each other.

review_title: One word sums up this movie...
review_detailed_main: Painful. Period. This movie is so bad it is painful to watch. If the MST3K guys weren't cracking on it, I would have turned it off after the first "scene." Just Painful.

review_title: hands of fate, brains of idiocy
review_detailed_main: "'Manos' the Hands of Fate" is another grade-Z litany of worthlessness. A family is on vacation and drives up to what looks like an abandoned hotel run by semi-hunchback Torgo, who can't stop talking about his "master". When we finally meet the master, he turns out to be the Devil's servant, and he's got evil plans for the family. How many times have we seen this kind of story?! Fortunately, "MST3K" saved the movie. Mike, Servo and Crow really liked the scene where the master's scantily clad wives were having a fistfight (there weren't really any other memorable scenes in the movie). On it's own, "MTHOF" is a total zero, but the "MST3K" version is a 10/10.

review_title: There are few pleasures like it
Had to struggle to stay awake watching this movie
review_detailed_main:
****SPOILERS**** Embarrassingly bad movie about a lost couple, Michael & Margaret, and their little girl Debbie ending up in this creepy house with an even creepier care-taker Torgo. Torgo to his credit told the couple to stay away from the house because his Master don't want anyone there. But Michael and Margaret just ignored him and made themselves at home and even had Torgo help them move in.

Torgo looked like he was recovering from a really bad LSD trip and when you saw him walk he would sway from side to side with his legs looking like they were suffering from a very severe case of elephantiasis. The Master, who has a striking resemblance to Frank Zappa, was at the time asleep, in a zombie-like trance, in his tomb with his six wives located somewhere outside the house.

Torgo was very angry at the Master for having six wives while he had none and had his eye on the nice looking Margaret for his future mate. We see Torgo later trying to grope Margaret but his actions are so weird that it really looks like he just wanted to hold on to her in order for him not to lose his balance and fall on his face ending up breaking his head.

When the Master finally awakes he finds Torgo out cold as if he were a corpse and after bringing him back to life he berates him for letting the strangers into his home. The Master also accuses Torgo of fooling around with his wives while he, as well as they, was asleep in the tomb.

Later that night the Master gets the whole crazy crew together and the wives become enraged over Torgo letting Michael and the two women, Margaret and her little daughter Debbie into the house and want to have them all killed. But the Master's first wife only wants to have Michael killed and have the women, especially little Debbie, left alive. A fight breaks out between the wives over who should live and who should die of the three strangers but the Master settles to only kill Torgo for letting them in the house in the first place.

Having Torgo tied down the Master then orders his wives to beat him to death. But it looks more like they were giving Torgo a total body massages instead of beating him and Torgo looked like he was really enjoying all of it. The Master then has Torgo's left hand blown off by touching some magic staff that he has and we then see Torgo, minus his left hand, running into the darkness never to be seen again in the movie.

Having his #1 wife tied to a poll for talking back to him the Master then proceeds to beat her to death. But the beating, like the one that Torgo got from the Master's wives,looked so harmless and phony that his wife must have died from laughing herself to death instead of the beating that the Master gave her.

Meanwhile back at the house Michael and Margaret and little Debbie make a run for freedom in he dark desert but are caught by the Master and his wives before they get too far away. The movie ends with Michael replacing Torgo as the Master's care-taker and both Margaret and Debbie becoming his two new wives replacing wife #1; Or let's just say two for the price of one if thats what it all meant?

What can be said about this movie that hasn't been said already. The two things I can add of what I noticed about "Manos the hands of fate" is that it was shot in color which was rare for a super low-budget, $20,000.00, film like it was back in 1966. As for the syrupy soundtrack it sounded like a music for a romantic or love story type film not the horrible horror movie that "Manos" was and is.

review_title: "Manos" The Hands of Fate: "There is no escape!"
review_detailed_main:
There is no denying it: '"Manos" The Hands of Fate' is a terrible, terrible film. With, seemingly no plot, and some of the worst acting ever caught on film, '"Manos"' is an incomprehensible mess. It doesn't help that it was filmed on a silent-film camera and that the voices were dubbed in by a team of only three voice actors. Add the inept direction of Hal P. Warren, and '"Manos"' hits excruciating levels of awfulness. But I'll be damned if I couldn't take my eyes off it for a single second.

Starring Torgo, a strange grounds keeper, '"Manos"' is supposed to be a horror film about a satanic cult. Hal Warren lets us know Torgo is evil by giving him a near-crippling knee deformity. OOOOHHH...SCARY. Torgo mumbles and stutters incoherently about his master, who wouldn't like having guests at their one-room motel. Mike, Maggie, and their daughter Debbie wind up said motel and then...basically nothing happens for the rest of the film. The plot moves so slowly and laboriously that it's better to just sit back and watch without thinking. At all. By doing this, I managed to make it through this awful movie and find out the "mysterious" ending, which I genuinely can not understand. Maybe it's better that way.

The problems with '"Manos"' are numerous. Warren couldn't frame a shot to save his life, the actors couldn't act if you put a gun to their head, and the sets are cheap and poorly made. The film begins with an endless driving sequence, which was supposed to be the opening credit sequence. However they forgot to add the credits, so we're left with ten minutes of nothing. The two policemen in the film spend all their time hunting down a teenage couple who like to make out on the side of the road, and when the cops do investigate Torgo's motel, they do so by walking two steps in each direction. The dubbing is off. WAY off. And I do believe this is the film that originated "Hey! I can see the zipper on his back!"

'"Manos"' has gained a cult following thanks to a spectacular episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000. Joel, Crow, and Servo provide their trademark witty remarks throughout, and also take time to remind us that we are indeed watching '"Manos" The Hands of Fate'. They can't believe they have to watch this, of all films, and neither can their tormentors, Frank and Dr. Forrester (and they picked the damn thing!). It's amazing that such a terrible film could turn out what some consider the greatest episode of MST3K.

So, why did I give '"Manos"' a point? Because it's fascinatingly bad, and provides an important lesson in how not to make a film. This movie is so bad, that it warrants serious studying, just to find out why it wound up so bad. The documentary "Hotel Torgo" should provide some answers, and I hope to get the chance to see it.

Should you see '"Manos"'? Yes, but only the MST3K version.

The Master commands you!

review_title: SUCK-O-RAMA
review_detailed_main: This thing is just absurd. When I first read Encyclopedia Obscura's review of this movie, I couldn't believe it was real; it was the DUMBEST plot I've ever heard of! Not the general evil-cult type thing; that could've worked. But when we get to the part about a satyr with a nerve disorder and the film showing you a portrait three times over just to make sure you figure it out, when you're watching IL' Torgo go scampering off on fire and not making a sound, you realize: The director was lacking basic brain function. A camera with no sound I can handle. That's basically what happens with animated movies, after all. But a movie where they have three people total on the voice-acting cast? A movie with no music at all? A movie with novice actors AND no post-production to remove their blunders? SUCKO, man. There's this one bit of the movie that I love: the bit when the family first enters the house where the wife is looking around, focuses her attention on the camera, rolls her eyes as she realizes she's not supposed to, then hurriedly looks away. Hehehe. This movie had on the floor for weeks. It's quite possibly the worst thing to come out of the movie industry. I'm not surprised four actors did themselves in after this; it's the cinematic equivalent of Hiroshima.

review_title: "Every frame looks like someone's last known photo . . ."
review_detailed_main:
Without a doubt, MANOS, THE HANDS OF FATE has to be the one movie that really enforces the credo of "must be seen to be believed." You can *not* really describe this move, for words alone can not do it justice. MANOS is like a 200 car pile up on I95 that, no matter how hard you try, you simply can *not* turn away from. "You can not even begin to conceptualize the horror" that *is* MANOS unless it is watched . . . and yet, this is one movie that should not be watched by *anyone*! And anyone who watches this vile, sickening, inept, insipid, stomach-turning, bile-inducing piece of garbage WITHOUT the aid of MST3K is either a sadist, or deserves a Purple Heart. If you do, then my only advice would be to hunker down, and pray for daylight!

The plot? Well, um a family made up of incompetent dad, mom and little kid drive off for a vacation. They drive . . . and drive. And, did I mention that they drive? Well, they do. When they're done, (after the harrowing "getting pulled over for a busted taillight" scene), they proceed to keep driving. After about 20 minutes, they finally happen upon a run down shack in the middle of the desert, and a chap named Torgo, who "takes care of the place while the master is away."

After about another 30 minutes of nothing, the Frank Zappa/Bill Buckner "Master" guy wakes up, intent on . . . doing something . . . bad to them. His shear-nightie dressed wives begin to wrestle in the dirt for his affection. Poor sap Torgo is slapped around, had his hand burnt off, and then just sort of wanders away . . . right out of the movie.

Will the family escape the horrors of this place? Will the wives decide to help the family or harm them? What about Peppy? ("You never had a dog! I want you to stop this foolishness about a dog!") And, really, more importantly, does anyone really care? I know I didn't.

If only Hal Warren had been as plucky, and prolific as Ed D. Wood and made more than one movie in his short, brief career. Compaired to this, PLANET 9 FROM OUTER SPACE looks like 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY.

And who knows what depths of wretchedness MANOS PART II: TORGO'S REVENGE might have sunk to?

review_title: Greatest comedy of all time!
review_detailed_main: IMDb and other movie websites have messed up, the genre of this movie is comedy, isn't it? Seriously, you can't expect me to believe that this is a horror movie.This really is a funny movie that everyone should check out. The parody in this movie is really great and clever. But honestly, why is this movie getting such low marks?! People don't understand the greatness of this movie, just really really funny. IF you're bored just try to find this movie classic. It's on Amazon and in 100 great horror Classics, why I don't know. But this is a seriously great comedy, everyone should see it. But I can't help but wonder, why is this movie posed as a horror movie? I mean that can't be serious, can it. There's no way that this is a horror movie, it's got to be a comedy. No way it can be a horror movie, can it?

review_title: The absolute PITS!
review_detailed_main: Forget the rest of the contenders for the worst movie of all time - Manos: Hands of Fate wins hands down! To anyone who hasn't witnessed this abomination of a movie, you just don't know what you've missed until you actually experience it. If you can think of the worst film you've ever encountered, and then double, triple and quadruple the shock horror of that experience, then you are on the right track for this sad, sad effort. It really does have to be seen to be believed. Little wonder that none of the actors (using the term loosely) ever appeared in anything else on screen - they must have abandoned the thought of pursuing any acting career when they saw the finished article. However, following this enterprise, the only way they could have gone was upwards! To adequately describe the actual content of the film is virtually impossible, as it is simply an all-over horrendous experience. Had a group of pre-school children been handed a movie camera and a half hour of play, they'd produce something better than this! Avoid like the plague!!!!!

review_title: The Curse of Manos The Hands Of Fate
review_detailed_main: Hal must have angered the Gods when making this tripe. The same year this was made, the actor who played Torgo committed suicide. Not convinced? The actress that played Marget also took her own life right after. Was it mere shame, or the Curse of Manos?

review_title: Why was this movie made!
Cinema's most famous one hit wonder is a truly moving epic
review_detailed_main: Hal Warren's early departure from the film industry was perhaps the greatest loss of talent the world had ever seen. Manos: The Hands Of Fate quickly led him to fame, hailed as the equal of Kubrick and Tarkovsky by most critics. And yet, after his single film, he never again directed; instead focusing on his career in fertilizer sales. The film still stands up to modern scrutiny due to its brilliant plot and truly moving performances by all of its actors, especially Reynolds in his role as the tragic character of Torgo. One of the most significant influences on virtually all subsequent films, one can only imagine what masterpieces Warren could have created if he had only remained in the field.

review_title: A turd in the rough?
review_detailed_main: What is a terrible turd of a movie is also a beautiful diamond when given the appropriate treatment by MST3K.

review_title: Manos: The Hands of Fate
Traumatizingly bad
review_detailed_main:
Never before have I given a rating of one star to a movie, until now. I'd give it a negative rating if I could. Never in my life have I seen such an awful movie, and I like to watch B movies on purpose. I thought Eegah and Monster-A-Go-Go were the worst, until this evening when I watched Manos the Hands of Fate.

Basically, a family gets lost driving out in the desert Southwest and inadvertently happens across a group of devil worshipers. The twitchy Torgo greets them at the door and at first tries to discourage them from staying there, but the brainless husband overrules his wife's common sense and decides that they will stay.

What is the worst aspect of this train wreck of a movie? Is it the improbable storyline? Is it the constantly jumping screen from incredibly bad editing? Is it the more-nerve-wracking-than-a-dentist's-drill musical accompaniment? Is it the horrible acting? Never, never in my life have I ever seen such cinematic sludge. This movie will kill more of your brain cells than a week-long binge on crack cocaine...

review_title: So bad... you have to see it with your Hands!
review_detailed_main:
After years of reading that Manos: The Hands of Fate is one of the worst movies that was destined to go to the very bottom of the annals of bad cinema, I finally rented it to catch the experience myself. How else was I to know how bad movies would get without watching what is called the ultimate in cheesiness? Well, Manos sure didn't disappoint. Or should I say, boy, it disappointed. I've seen many an Ed Wood movie, and I can say that even Mr. Wood himself seems like a master film maker next to the diseases that this movie is. Don't get me wrong, I mean that in a good way, really I do. There is nothing better then popping in the Mystery Science Theater version of this movie and hearing them poke fun at this movie. I laughed hard, and it made me think, what if? What if this movie was burned and never found... we would have lost a treasure! Watching the movie is a test in patience. It also ruins your intelligence and makes you feel that rather then watching a movie, you are watching a bunch o' hippies that are high and/or drunk sort of flow through an imaginary script. They should show this movie at a stress test, perhaps give you a passing grade, or a degree or something that states you've accomplished a feat that only a few can do.

I can't even begin to tell you what scene would be the worst! Was it the loooong drive in the beginning, where nothing happens except driving set to some jazz music? The "teens" making out for days? The fact that the father is an idiot and led his family to all the craziness, amid the danger? The laughable audio that was dubbed in? The cat fights? Even the title of the movie, Manos, which means "hands" in Spanish, effectively makes this movie title "Hands: The Hands of Fate".

What I can tell you is the best part of the movie: watching the "Master" come out with his robe and show off the big red hands stitched into it. That amused for about 4 seconds. All downhill from there. Actually, the whole movie was a downhill that kept going into the ground and never stops, winding up in some inner core lava.

One gets the feeling that perhaps some of the actors, like maybe Tom Neyman or John Reynolds would have better served their art with a better script. One also gets the feeling that each and every person associated with this that saw the script, or met the director, or even smelled the manure on him should be drawn and quartered. It seems, though, that the cast DID indeed see how bad this movie was going to be by making fun of it, as they started calling it "Mangos: The Cans of Fruit".

So, should you watch this movie? Oh yes, you must! ONLY if you rent the MST3000 version (I heard that an unedited version is now available, now THAT must be eye-gouging torture). It's good to see how bad a movie can get and still laugh at it. I give the movie a rating of 1, and the MST3000 version a 9!

I was interested enough to try to find out as much information about this movie as I could when I found that a documentary called Hotel Torgo (2004) exists. There, they interview one of the last surviving members of the cast (I don't think they found any others that may still be alive) and even bring him to the location of the set, an old run down house in the middle of nowhere. It's worth a watch.

A review of another film within a review? It can only happen with Manos: The Hands of Fate!

review_title: It's....well....you've gotta watch it to understand
review_detailed_main:
I don't think there's much that I can say about this film that hasn't yet been said, but really it's just a fun waste of and hour or two. But make sure not to watch it alone, because your head might explode. Get the MST3K version (buy the essentials) and get some friends together and get ready to have a good time. I laughed until it hurt.

A quick introduction to the movie if you haven't heard anything of it: A father, mother, and daughter (with their trusty poodle) are en route to some sort of lodge for vacation, when they are lost. They find a shack in the middle of nowhere, where a crazy guy named Torgo lets them stay but warns them of the master. I don't want to give any more away because something has to keep you going. Good Luck!

review_title: Bad, but I kinda enjoy it.
The worst movie i've ever seen
review_detailed_main: It was so bad, even Mystery Science Theater 3000 couldn't help it. I still talk about it. The only part I found memorable was an *extended* helicopter shot of the car driving past cornfields, and Crow (from MST3000) narrating, "We drove on for what seemed like minutes." There, now you don't have to watch it!

review_title: Unbelievable!
review_detailed_main: It is unbelievable that this movie has a higher rating than Hobgoblins. This movie apparently does not believe in jumping right into the action as the first twenty minutes is nothing more than voice lessons for the MST3K crew, as they can say nothing but "Manos: Hands of Fate". The first part of the film could have been made into a short entitled "Stock Footage: How Far Can You Go". There is a truly unique film technique used as one scene fades away to the exact same scene. The best scene is a pathetic mass fight scene between Manos's wives. And how could you comment on this movie without mentioning the king of husky sized pants, Torgo. I consider my life a failure for having seen this movie.
With the help of MST3K, this is a pretty funny movie, funny enough to be rather enjoyable. Without MST3K, the production value of this movie is so bad that it's close to unwatchable.

review_title: Horribly wonderful
review_detailed_main: This film might very well be the worst film ever made, and is one of the all-time great entertainments. Not to be missed by any true film buff.

review_title: Why this isn't #1 on the bottom 100 is beyond me.
review_detailed_main:
I watched the MST3K version just to see how bad the worst movie ever could be. Could it really be that bad? Simply put, yes it is. Every aspect of this movie is horrible. Any present day filmmaker (professional or amateur) would have to work awfully hard to deliberately make a worse movie. The acting, dialog, sound, cinematography, plot, subplot, action, and music are all the worst I've ever seen. I'm a screen writing major and amateur filmmaker myself, so I've sat through a lot of movies. I was laughing hysterically (mostly at the MST3K's jokes) at how bad and horrendously this movie was put together.

For anyone out there making a movie of your own, and tormented with feelings of inadequacy or doubt at your own talents, I would advise you to watch this (the MST3K version first). Nothing you make could possibly be this bad. FYI: The regular version is available on DVD. I bought it cheap online to see if I can stand to view it.

And as the movie's stupid, insulting ending finally faded out, I got up with an uneasy feeling in my body, knowing I'd never sit through a movie that bad as long as I shall live. I think I've made my point.

review_title: so bad & ridiculous that it's a must see!
review_detailed_main: So bad & ridiculous that it's a must see! one of those "we got lost in Texas" films. in some ways precursor to Texas Chainsaw Massacre. One wonders if Toby Hooper had seen this film. The bright red hands robe costume it is actually pretty effective. the music is really strange as well. might've been fun to see at a drive in theater back in the day.

review_title: Wow. I mean... wow.
review_detailed_main:
I saw this movie (as most people probably did) as a Mystery Science Theater 3000 show. The constant rips into the film by the Satellite of Love crew is the only way I would have been able to sit through this steaming pile of wonderment. The camera work, acing, pacing, ah, who am I kidding? The drive to the doomed hotel is torture alone.

Everything was bad is this film. I think the people who made this movie were clinically dead creatively. While I support low-budget film, there is not one single clever, original or memorable moment in this film. At best the film borderlines on gratuitous exploitation.

Wait, I take that back.

Redemption comes via the infamous "Torgo theme" with its monotonous 4-note theme is still a popular in-joke between my friends and I. I still wonder to this day why they never made a soundtrack to this movie.

Hate someone you know? Send them this movie. Only MST3K made this movie bearable enough to watch (I enjoyed the "Manos" reference in the MST3K movie. Classic).

review_title: See it to Believe it
review_detailed_main: Many people told me Manos is the worse movie they have ever seen. I couldn't believe, so I had a chance to watch the movie. Well it is extremely bad. The movie isn't that long, but it feels like it lasts 3 hours. It feels that nearly 50% of the movie involves watching the mountains and trees along the road. The other part of the movie is the couple that seems to be in a kissing marathon for three straight days and had nothing to do with the movie except being pulled over by the police on several occasions. Now the women wrestling don't even look as believable and the story line and plot? What story line. How about the acting. Well their acting is a as perfect as a three year old reciting poetry in front of the class. It is that perfect. The entire cast of actors have a true talent of appearing to be a three year old acting ability. The most ridiculous part of the movie are that unusual fat legs that walks wobbly. Funny why this guy with a leg problem cares to help carry the luggage, he can't even walk! If you dare to watch the real Manos the Hands of Fate, you will fall dead. Please watch the MST3K version. Be warned, you will go into comatose.

review_title: I Have All The ANSWERS!!!
review_detailed_main: Well... not all the answers. I read in Entertainment Weekly last week all about this movie. Seems it started as a bet. Hal Warren thought directing a movie was easy. Anyone could do it. Hal Warren was given some money and the rest is history. Most of the people working on the film knew something was up. They all agreed to do it in return for shares of the profits. But in Producers fashion, the shares added up to 300%! In the end, the only casts members to be "paid" were the little girl (a bicycle) and the dog (50 lb bag of dog food). They knew they were in trouble, but were assured all the mistakes could be fixed in some magic editing room. Which ceased to be an option when the money started running out. There was a premiere which the casts went to.. all but Torgo, who committed suicide a few weeks earlier (not resulting from being in the movie). It was at the premiere the cast found out their voices were all dubbed! There was silence for about 15 minutes.. then some chuckles.. which evolved into out and out laughter! The producer and director didn't stay, and went to a bar. The place where it was filmed is still around and somewhat of a cult tourist attraction. The little girl remembers the guy who played Torgo as being the nicest, but others thought he was on acid the whole time!. The girl remembered the director as someone who yelled all the time and wasn't very nice. Say what you will about this movie.. it certainly has it's place in history, but people need to stop calling it "genius" or "classic". It's also wrong to compare it this to Ed Wood Jr. At least he had passion about what he was doing.. he thought he was making classics.. Manos: The Hands Of Fate was made on a bet!

review_title: The artistic value of Manos...
review_detailed_main:
I'm not kidding: watching this thing, if you can endure it without injuries (I did it the easiest way: I watched the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version of it...), teaches you quite a few things. Ergo, it has "value", albeit in a very broad sense. More like a function, really. First, one can use it to calibrate one's rating scale. This is as close as a standard 1 as you'll ever get. I won't repeat all the previous comments about the movie: every reasonable or even average-minded person will agree on the absolute nullity of this full nadir in the history of cinema: so, it is very useful to set your scale to zero (that is, 1 by definition at IMDb). As a corollary, which may be construed as its second function, "Manos..." is thus the perfect universal ground zero on which every other movie suddenly takes a contour and perspective, including famous "worst ever-s" that abound in opinions that cluster around titles such as the inevitable "Plan 9 from Outer Space", which, thanks to Manos, gives a novel elegance to the Art of Ed Wood. Such an important role for Manos cannot be overestimated: force every IMDb under 18 to watch Manos (there are ways to check if they did their homework!!! 😂) and I'm sure we won't read reviews with that dreaded condemnation: this is the worst movie EVER! Anymore because everybody knows it's Manos.

In summary, we must thank Harold P. Warren for rallying all the critics around his Bizarro world masterpiece, where antiactors play antiroles with an antiscript and move along through a hostile environment of floating antimatter, risking dramatic annihilation at every antimoment until the very end, where they finally dissolve in a cosmic explosion when all that antimatter hits true matter, and the viewer reads the word DNE EHT on the last frame of Manos.

What a great experience it was!

review_title: Manos, thou of primal darkness, mud-wrestling, and drug-addled easy listening jazz.
review_detailed_main: Behold, children, if you dare, Manos the Hands of Fate. The literal brainchild of star, director, writer, producer and crap-salesman Harold P. Warren, this is the Necronomicon of modern film; as you view it, your sanity is slowly nibbled away. It would seem given the experience of the crew, one shouldn't bash this film so badly. Wrong. A 10 year old could make a marginally better film than this stillborn brainchild of a fertilizer salesman. The characters and settings are so clichéd one of the only original things about this movie is it features a mini documentary of various bean fields and hills hosted by an Alto who sounds as if she's in extreme pain. Tor-goat seems like a bum they pulled out of the streets and slapped prosthetics onto. The "wonderful" subplot of him being a Satyr is killed by a deadly team of bad camera-work and sloppy writing. To those not in the know, he's just a creepy beard-man in serious need of more comfortable kneepads. He and the master's "eerie" presence is denoted by "eerie-er" free-style jazz that sounds like something Charlie parker threw up, Tito Puente cooked and Kenny G garnished and ate. No, that applies to the rest of the movie. It's just so mind-bogglingly bad that it's impossible to watch without heckling it. Probably the best way to watch this is with the help of Joel Hogsdon, Kevin Murphy, and Trace Beaulieu in the MST3K version.

review_title: We have a loser!
review_detailed_main:
I recently picked up a copy of MST3K's "Manos: The Hands of Fate" and have watched it twice (so I could see if it was really as bad as I thought it was the first time).

It was WORSE.

The ONLY credit I will give to this film is that the underlying (more like buried) concept is actually somewhat scary when you think about it (for those that have seen it, of course).

Thing is, they did NOTHING right in this movie.

The acting was so awful that it was mind-boggling. The plot was almost non-existent. The cinematography was hideous. The design was shoddy. Half the scenes had no relevance to whatever minor flow the movie had to begin with. It was, however, another one of MST3K's shining moments (but even they were often in awe of how miserable this flick is!)

To date, this is the worst movie I have ever seen. Though not by much, it's worse than "Space Mutiny" (and that's saying A LOT). I REALLY don't want to imagine this movie without Joel and the robots.

review_title: One-Off, The Best of the Worst
review_detailed_main:
Once in a lifetime, a film comes along that is such an affront to all that is good, right and sane that it removes paint and varnish from most surfaces. That film is "Manos" The Hands of Fate, which has been deftly recycled for your bad movie enjoyment by MST3K.

In 10 years and countless searches, MST3K never did find another character/performance to equal the nadir of John Reynolds' `Torgo'. He hems, haws and generally looks uncomfortable, even as an inebriate--he is quite obviously smashed throughout the film. The `big knees' were his idea, as he was going for the Satyr look that was all the craze in Texas in the drug soaked '60's. He really did think about this.

Warren never did another film. So many of the greats have only one work to their name, as if the pinnacle of their achievement was their only purpose for passing through this misty vale that we call `life'. The shining star that shined so bright for this director perhaps burned his `manos' right off, as if the gods themselves were affronted by his attempt to touch the eternal truths. Or maybe there was just more money in other steaming piles of manure. Depends who ya ask.

I will leave you with this MST3K quip: `Every frame of this film looks like somebody's last known photograph.' Woah! That's so true, dude!

review_title: Absolutely horrible
review_detailed_main:
This movie is one of the WORST movies ever. There's alot that is wrong but the things that makes me the most mad are the following.

Long pauses: I get if things move fast, you might forget whats happening. But here, the pauses makes you forget since nothing happens for literally 20 seconds.

Plot: The plot is nothing new, it's a common plot that has been done before. But, since the movie is from the 60s, I guess the topic was new/trendy?

Music: The probaby worst thing about this movie. At first I liked it, but it soon gets boring since its repeated during the whole movie. The most "original" song is in the beginning, where somebody sang some "opera" but when one of the characters say something you barely hear anything from them, due to the "opera" Other than that, expect some maniac playing the piano and somebody blowing their lungs out on a saxophone.

The only "good" thing is the camera angles. Most of them are bad, but some are really good. Many scenes are done in one take though.

1/10 Would give zero if possible.

review_title: TURN IT OFF!!!!
Well, um, I uh, um, like, what the....i don't know ha ha?
An extraordinary turkey experience from the wastelands of space
review_detailed_main:
(The first thing that must be said, is that I think MST3k is totally pointless. I love watching cheesy old oddball B-movies, but not with a bunch of silly robots ruining the experience. I treated "Manos" as it should be treated -- I let it speak for itself.)

There's not much to be said that's already been said about this movie's lack of... just about everything. I saw it for the first time just now, and I'm still baffled. This is not a case of "so bad, it's good". It's not even a case of "so bad, I want to spew my run screaming into the woods, using my own hand for a torch".

This movie reaches beyond "bad", and comes out on the other side. It's set entirely in a parallel universe, where time and logic are twisted beyond recognition for mortals. What looks like Texas is actually the other end of a worm hole, where the fabric of space has turned itself inside-out.

It HAS TO be this way. How else could a movie be so indescribably... not "bad", that word is to simple and two-dimensional... mesmerising, but yet so extraordinary painful and genuinely creepy... you feel the movie slowly pressing a pole into your blackened heart, and you make sure to keep the remote control near in case you should feel a psychosis coming... but still you're always on the verge of laughing your head off... and at the end, you can almost feel your brain suppressing the whole experience, and you will never, never be sure what actually happened during these 80 minutes.

THIS MOVIE IS EVIL. If you're looking for a great turkey experience, something out of this world, that leaves you with a smile on your face and a somewhat altered way of relating to movies in general, I suggest "Glen or Glenda".

I guess I will never look upon more ordinary B-movies the same way again. The thought isn't pleasant, but I still don't regret watching "Manos" for a second. It had to be done.

review_title: A movie doesn't get voted the worst of all time without reason...
review_detailed_main:
I'm not using my real name so that I'm not associated with this film in any way, shape or form.

This movie was the ultimate in bad. Bad acting, bad script, generally annoying. The plot was erratic and stupid. It was a horror picture, all right, in the sense that it's hard to imagine more horrible a movie. The music was good, but that's like saying "at least the incinerator I was burned alive in was clean"! It was bad! Awful! I couldn't even think of a worse torture! There were only a few characters that were even remotely good (i.e., the robots), but once again I refer to my previous incinerator metaphor!

This movie really stinks. However, I only thought about shutting it off once - from the moment it began until it ended! The best part was when it was finally over!

Once again, bad, bad, awful movie. If you want to rent it, don't say I didn't warn you about being scarred for life by the sheer monstrosity of this production.

Don't let any of your pets see this movie or they'll have to be put down.
